body_html:
What I also find confusing is that it says the input should be [6,1,5,5] (the desired output not input of the first conv2d layer in lenet), when the right input is [64, 1, 32, 32].
On Mon, Sep 17, 2018, 3:01 PM Justin Terry ***@***.***> wrote: Southmith has it exactly right. The part about channels I was just suggesting to also include "maybe missing channel deminsion" to the default message, because I suspect that that's by far the most common cause of this error. On Mon, Sep 17, 2018, 2:52 PM Soumith Chintala ***@***.***> wrote: > I think the missing part in the error message (that I can relate to > @justinkterry <https://github.com/justinkterry> 's usage) is that it > doesn't say: you gave me 3D, while I expected 4D. > It just says: "you gave me this shape, this is not a good shape for me." > > — > You are receiving this because you were mentioned. > > > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub > <#11762 (comment)>, > or mute the thread > <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AShd7HBDTZAa2hfXzmt-s4HZB0QICm6vks5ub-99gaJpZM4WsYFz> > . > -- Thank you for your time, Justin Terry
-- Thank you for your time, Justin Terry
body_text:
What I also find confusing is that it says the input should be [6,1,5,5]
(the desired output not input of the first conv2d layer in lenet), when the
right input is [64, 1, 32, 32].
On Mon, Sep 17, 2018, 3:01 PM Justin Terry ***@***.***> wrote:
 Southmith has it exactly right. The part about channels I was just
 suggesting to  also include "maybe missing channel deminsion" to the
 default message, because I suspect that that's by far the most common cause
 of this error.

 On Mon, Sep 17, 2018, 2:52 PM Soumith Chintala ***@***.***>
 wrote:

> I think the missing part in the error message (that I can relate to
> @justinkterry <https://github.com/justinkterry> 's usage) is that it
> doesn't say: you gave me 3D, while I expected 4D.
> It just says: "you gave me this shape, this is not a good shape for me."
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
>
>
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <#11762 (comment)>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AShd7HBDTZAa2hfXzmt-s4HZB0QICm6vks5ub-99gaJpZM4WsYFz>
> .
>
 --
 Thank you for your time,
 Justin Terry

-- 
Thank you for your time,
Justin Terry
body:
What I also find confusing is that it says the input should be [6,1,5,5]
(the desired output not input of the first conv2d layer in lenet), when the
right input is [64, 1, 32, 32].

On Mon, Sep 17, 2018, 3:01 PM Justin Terry <justinkterry@gmail.com> wrote:

> Southmith has it exactly right. The part about channels I was just
> suggesting to  also include "maybe missing channel deminsion" to the
> default message, because I suspect that that's by far the most common cause
> of this error.
